scenario.portfolio_analysis: Concentrated in 1 of 10 slots (one automotive/vehicle exposure); ample cash and slot headroom. Sector diversification would be meaningful upon adding biotech, with a mid-term investment horizon. Portfolio average return data not provided.
scenario.valuation_analysis: Forward P/E 30–40x, P/B ~1.8–2.2x, EV/EBITDA 19–23x, indicating a mid-to-upper valuation within the sector. Comparable to Samsung BioLogics, similar or slightly lower, with a premium versus traditional pharmaceutical companies. When accounting for distortions in the industry’s average P/E due to loss-making mix, the relative value is neutral to slightly expensive, but an earnings-upturn could justify a premium.
scenario.sector_outlook: The sector is supported by expanding global biosimilar/biopharmaceutical orders and merger synergies, but volatility remains due to pricing pressure, intensifying competition, and global macro variables. News/earnings triggers are in sensitive zones.
scenario.rationale: Volume surge and retest of the 182000–185000 resistance strengthen near-term momentum. If 175000 support holds, a stop-loss of up to 5.9% is manageable. Target 210000 to secure an R/R > 2:1.

sell_triggers: Take-profit Condition 1: Sell all upon reaching 200000; if volume slows or a bearish candle appears in the 205000–210000 zone, exit immediately.
Take-profit Condition 2: After clearing 185000, if the approach to 200000 fails within 3 trading days and volume collapses sharply, sell all.
Stop-loss Condition 1: If the close breaches 175000, exit immediately (loss under 7%; however, a strong intraday rebound with a sharp volume surge may allow a 1-day grace).
Stop-loss Condition 2: If a gap-down opens below 175000, exit at the open or when the first rebound fails; re-entry only after a renewed breakout above 182000 is confirmed.
Time condition: If 185000 is not breached within 10 trading days or the number of closes below the 20-day line increases, switch to a neutral stance.
hold_conditions: After a breakout above 185000, if a test of 182000–185000 confirms support, hold.
The 20-day and 60-day moving averages maintain an upward slope together, with the close staying above the 20-day moving average.
Net institutional/foreign buying and a 3-day average turnover above the baseline.
trading_scenarios.portfolio_context: Adding healthcare to an automotive-heavy portfolio provides sector diversification. This all-in/all-out system maintains an R/R > 2 with a strict 175000 stop and a 210000 target. Breakout scenarios take precedence; if failed, re-entry only after a renewed breakout is confirmed.

scenario.portfolio_analysis: Holding 0/10 slots, 100% cash. No specific sector exposure (ample diversification capacity). Flexible investment-horizon allocation. Favorable for initial entry.
scenario.valuation_analysis: 2025E: Hyundai Motor PER 6.5–8.5x, PBR ~0.8x, versus global full-vehicle averages (PER 11–12x, PBR 1.0–1.2x) – undervalued. Compared with peers: Kia PER ~5.1x, Toyota 13–15x, Stellantis ~4.6x, GM ~6.2x, Ford ~5.4x. Sources: FnGuide/Wise Report consensus, domestic brokerage reports (Kiwoom, Daishin, AlphaSquare summaries, etc.).
scenario.sector_outlook: Favorable mid-to-long-term outlook from rising EV/green-vehicle penetration and policy tailwinds (IRA/European regulations). However, volatility persists due to interest rates, exchange rates, economic slowdown, and intensified competition.
scenario.rationale: Valuation discounts vs peers (2025E PER 6–8x, PBR ~0.8x). Momentum supported by net foreign/institutional buying and third-place turnover (+28.5%). Enter near 240000–245000 support to secure an R/R > 2.

sell_triggers: Take-profit Condition 1: Reach 280000 or, in the 260000–265000 zone, a long bearish candlestick/engulfing pattern appears; sell all.
Take-profit Condition 2: After breakout above 265000, if volume collapses and RSI remains in overbought territory, indicating momentum weakness, exit on a candle that breaches the previous day’s low.
Stop-loss Condition 1: If the close breaks below 238000, exit immediately.

Stop-loss Condition 2: If support at 240000–245000 breaks and volume surges with accelerated declines (including gaps down), exit intraday (a strong intraday rebound with a volume spike within a 7% loss may allow a 1-day grace).
Time condition: If 260000 breakout fails within 4–6 weeks and the price tests the box bottom (240000) again, consider liquidation due to opportunity cost.
hold_conditions: Support at 240000–245000 remains and net buying by foreigners and institutions continues.
After clearing 260000, maintain a close above and confirm support, with turnover continuing to rise.
If earnings/policy momentum (surprise earnings, IRA-benefit news, etc.) remains valid, hold.
trading_scenarios.portfolio_context: Since the system does not support partial entries, use a single-entry per 1 slot (10%). If entering near support, cap loss at about -3% to -5% with a stop at 238000; target 280000 to achieve R/R ≥ 2. After initial entry, diversification into other sectors is possible.

watchlist.sector: Electronic materials / secondary battery materials (OLEDs / battery foil)

scenario.valuation_analysis: Based on FN Guide / Wise Report latest estimates, PER 30~35x, PBR ~1.4x. On daily trailing indicators, PER spikes high due to volatility / temporary losses. Compared with peers (battery foil / electronic materials, OLED), PBR is similar; PER is neutral to conservative assuming earnings recovery. In other words, there is no absolute undervaluation conviction; it is in a zone reflecting a momentum premium.
scenario.sector_outlook: Structural growth stories in EVs, energy transition, OLED are valid, but industry conditions / demand volatility and intensifying competition persist. News / order-win events are sensitive. The sector overall has strong near-term momentum but risk of greater volatility on pullbacks.
scenario.rationale: Strong momentum confirmed by surge in trading volume and a golden cross. Support at 9,800–10,000 and resistance at 12,500/14,000 are clear. However, overheating and high volatility with limited valuation appeal suggest waiting for a correction / re-confirmation before entering.
scenario.sector: Electronic materials / secondary battery materials (OLEDs / battery foil)

sell_triggers: Take-profit Condition 1: When 12,000–12,500 (first resistance) is reached with a bearish candle and waning volume, liquidate all.
Take-profit Condition 2: After breaking 12,500 upward, if 14,000–15,000 is reached and a long bullish candle forms with volume fading / RSI remaining overbought, sell.
Stop-loss Condition 1: If it closes below 10,000, exit all immediately (risk around -5 to -6%).
Stop-loss Condition 2: After an intraday breach of 10,000, if a rebound fails and two consecutive bearish candles with rising volume appear, indicate accelerated decline and sell immediately.
Time condition: In a 10,400–11,800 box, if it trades sideways for 10+ trading days with thinning volume, consider unwinding due to opportunity cost.
hold_conditions: Maintain support at a close above 10,000 and volume normalization (above average)
After breaking 12,500, on a retest confirm that 12,000–12,500 becomes support
Sustained net buying by institutions / foreigners or accompanying momentum news on the industry / orders

scenario.rationale: Strong short- to mid-term momentum from aligned uptrends and a surge in trading volume, or proximity to ATH resistance (28,000–29,500), leading to high near-term volatility. Valuation sits in the neutral PBR range, with low visibility for PER. Given the non-split system characteristics, there is an advantage to stay on the sideline until a pullback entry or a clearly confirmed breakout.

sell_triggers: Take-profit 1: Reach or approach 31,000 with volume fading and a bearish candle formation
Take-profit 2: After a strong breakout above 29,500, if a large bearish candle/overheat signal appears near 32,000 with RSI confirmed at 70+, realize profits

Stop-loss 1: If the close falls below 24,800, exit all positions immediately (exception: if there is a strong intraday rebound with sharply higher volume and the loss is below 7%, allow a 1-day grace)
Stop-loss 2: If breaking downward below 23,000 with expanded volume indicating accelerated decline, reconsider re-entry after 21,000 support is reconfirmed
Time condition: If the target is not reached within 4–6 weeks and the stock remains in a 26,000–29,500 range, consider exiting due to opportunity costs
hold_conditions: Net foreign and institutional buying and ranking among top trading-value players (rank improving)
Close above 23,000 with 5-, 20-, and 60-day moving averages in bullish alignment
Even if it breaks above 29,500 and then falls back, the trend remains valid if 28,000 holds as support
trading_scenarios.portfolio_context: The current portfolio has ample room, with 1/10 slot allocated. No other stock in the same sector, favorable diversification. This stock, due to the non-split system characteristics, follows a “pullback-first” approach: buy 1 slot in the 26,000–27,000 pullback zone; only after a confirmed close above 29,500 with accompanying volume is chasing allowed. The scenario’s target/stop is set with entry around 26,500± (target 31,000, stop 24,800 → risk/reward roughly 2:1 to 2.5:1). With the current price in the 28,000–29,500 high zone, avoid aggressive chasing and wait for price and volume confirmation before entering.

scenario.rationale: The trend is strong, but the distance to the first support is large relative to the current price, making it hard to adhere to the -7% stop rule. Enter after re-confirming support at 24,000–25,000 or after a breakout above 29,500 and successful stabilization; trend-following is reasonable. Valuation remains attractive on a price-to-book basis (low PBR).

sell_triggers: Take-profit 1: After a 29,500 breakout with volume sustained, exit fully near 31,000
Take-profit 2: Upon reaching 30,000, if a long upper wick occurs or volume collapses, take profit
Stop-loss 1: Close below 24,000 triggers immediate stop-loss of all
Stop-loss 2: Break below 25,000 and fail to rebound plus a surge in volume with a downward move to 23,500 triggers stop-loss
Time condition: If the stock remains in the 27,000–29,500 range for 3–4 weeks or more with waning volume, consider unwinding due to opportunity costs
hold_conditions: Reconfirm support at 24,000–25,000 and sustain volume-backed rebound
After breaking 29,500, close above for at least two consecutive sessions and maintain an upward-sloping 20-day moving average
When institutional/foreign net buying inflows continue for three or more consecutive days.

scenario.rationale: 4,200 support vs 4,500 resistance form a clear box, limiting upside. Reliability is low due to lack of confirmed valuation data. Given the system’s no-split-trade feature, stay on the sidelines until the support is re-confirmed or a breakout above the top is confirmed.

sell_triggers: Take-profit Condition 1: When price approaches 4,500 and volume slows and a bearish candlestick forms, sell all.
Take-profit Condition 2: Upon reaching 4,600 or breaking above the high, if within 2 days there is a failure to make a new high or volume declines, sell all.
Stop-loss Condition 1: A close below 4,060 triggers an exit of the entire position.
Stop-loss Condition 2: If intraday breaks below 4,040 with expanding volume, exit immediately.
Time rule: If the price trades in the 4,200–4,500 box for 2–4 weeks without momentum, consider exiting entirely to account for opportunity costs.
hold_conditions: After re-confirming 4,200 support, a pattern of higher highs and higher lows forms.
The trend of improving trading-volume ranking and liquidity normalization continues, offsetting sharp declines.
Positive rate/policy news persists (expectations for rate hold or cuts remain), reducing the risk premium.

sell_triggers: Take profit 1: If price reaches the 110,000–112,400 resistance zone and volume slows or a bearish candlestick forms, liquidate all.
Take profit 2: After a gap-up and move above 112,000, if an intraday bearish reversal occurs with sharply higher volume (supply/demand fatigue), lock in profits.
Stop loss 1: If the close falls to 95,500 (hard stop, about -5%), exit immediately.
Stop loss 2: If the 98,000 support breaks and volume surges with downside acceleration (e.g., breaking below 96,000), defensively liquidate even before the hard stop is reached.
Time condition: Within the 98,000–105,000 box, if there is no trend for 15+ trading days, volume dries up, and underperformance vs the index persists, consider exiting to avoid opportunity cost.
hold_conditions: If price closes above 105,000 and volume exceeds the average, indicating trend resumption, hold can be extended.
Hold if the price remains above the 20- and 60-day moving averages and the moving averages stay aligned upward.
Hold if institutional/foreign net buying persists and signals of improvement in memory ASP/AI server indicators continue.

scenario.valuation_analysis: Green Chemical PER ~26.9 (Jun 2025) is above Korea specialty chemicals average (~16–18), while PBR ~1.24 (FnGuide, Dec 2024) is below sector (~1.6–1.8). Mixed signal: earnings-rich multiple, asset-cheap vs peers. Sources: stockanalysis (083420, 2025-06-04), FnGuide (A083420, latest).
scenario.sector_outlook: Korea chemicals weak in H2’25 amid macro uncertainty, FX, and raw material volatility. Re-rating requires sector rotation or earnings recovery; upside if input cost stabilizes and exports recover.
scenario.rationale: Price near key 6,500 support; trading volume surged, indicating potential inflection. Momentum unconfirmed below 7,300; use confirmation-based entry with tight risk. Mixed valuation (high PER, low PBR) suggests selectivity.

sell_triggers: Take profit: Full exit near 7,450–7,500 if breakout above 7,300 fades (reversal candle or volume drop vs baseline).
Take profit: Strong breakout and close >7,300 with >2x baseline volume but immediate stall at 7,800—exit on bearish reversal day.
Stop loss: Close ≤6,400 or intraday flush below 6,400 with high volume—immediate full exit.
Stop loss: Clean break and close below 6,500 with >2x baseline volume (downward acceleration).
Time condition: If price remains trapped <7,200 and <20D MA for 15+ trading days without volume improvement, exit on weakness and re-evaluate.
hold_conditions: Closes above 6,500 while 5D MA turns up and crosses 20D MA with volume ≥ baseline.
Institutional/foreign net buying persists for several sessions alongside higher lows.
Post-breakout: After a close >7,300 with strong volume, maintain hold while price stays above 7,200 on closing basis.
trading_scenarios.portfolio_context: Adds non-auto exposure and potential cyclical rebound optionality. Use 1 slot (10%) only after confirmation due to all-in/out constraint; preserve capacity for stronger setups.

watchlist.portfolio_analysis: Holdings 1/10 (auto sector). Cash capacity high with 9 empty slots. No sector overlap with chemicals; mid-term bias. Diversification benefit if adding chemicals; avoid overtrading due to all-in/out system.
watchlist.valuation_analysis: Green Chemical PER ~26.9x (Jun 2025) is above Korea specialty chemicals average (~16–18x), while PBR ~1.24x (FnGuide, Dec 2024) is below sector (~1.6–1.8x). Mixed signal: earnings-rich multiple, asset-cheap vs peers. Sources: StockAnalysis (083420, 2025-06-04), FnGuide (A083420, latest).
watchlist.sector_outlook: Korea chemicals weak in H2’25 amid macro uncertainty, FX, and raw material volatility. Re-rating requires sector rotation or earnings recovery; upside if input cost stabilizes and exports recover.
watchlist.rationale: Price near key 6,500 support; trading value surged, indicating potential inflection. Momentum unconfirmed above 7,300; use confirmation-based entry with tight risk. Mixed valuation (high PER, low PBR) suggests selectivity.

scenario.portfolio_analysis: Hold 1/10 (1 in auto). New entry of battery materials provides strong diversification across industries. Mid-term weight has one slot available, but entry price should be set more conservatively due to the all-in/all-out system.
scenario.valuation_analysis: PBR about 1.1x (as of 11/10 close), undervalued vs peer average (2–4x). PER is in the 200x range due to weak EPS, limiting earnings-value appeal until profits recover. Institutional and foreign inflows and surging trading volume provide positive momentum, but earnings confirmation is needed.
scenario.sector_outlook: The second battery materials sector is expected to gradually recover after 2024–25 margin pressures, but is sensitive to EV demand, commodity prices, and policy variables. Volatility management is key until a rebound in the sector is confirmed.
scenario.rationale: A breakout above 32,000 accompanied by trading volume and net buying by institutions/foreigners suggests a short-term trend reversal. However, the rapid rise carries overheating/retracement risk, so consider buying on a test of 30,500 with a -6.9% stop, target +18% aiming for a risk-reward of 2.6:1. Wait for earnings and flow trends to confirm.

key_levels.volume_baseline: Average daily volume 50k–200k shares; 500k shares or more signals stronger momentum

sell_triggers: Target/resistance: around 36,000 as the first checkpoint; around 38,000 as a major rally; upon a bearish candlestick reversal, exit all positions
Momentum slowdown: at resistance (32,000–33,000) two consecutive long upper wicks with declining volume imply cautious profit-taking
Stop: Close below 28,400 triggers full exit (all shares sold)
Downside acceleration: break below 30,000 with volume surge (twice the average); if rebound fails to materialize, exit unconditionally
Time condition: If within 3–4 weeks a move above 32,000 fails to hold or a boxed range (30,000–32,000) persists long, consider exiting to avoid opportunity cost
hold_conditions: After 32,000 upside breakout and volume normalization (not a sharp fall), maintain higher-low
Re-test of 30,500 support followed by a bullish turn (institutional/foreign net buying continuing)
Break above 36,000: once closing basis confirms support, maintain trend-following
trading_scenarios.portfolio_context: Holding a car stock provides diversification when adding the materials sector. However, due to the all-in/all-out system, entry price should be limited near 30,500 to keep stop-loss within 7%.

watchlist.portfolio_analysis: Hold 1/10 (1 in auto). New entry into battery materials provides strong diversification. Mid-term weight has one spare slot, but entry price should be set even more conservatively due to the all-in/all-out system.
watchlist.valuation_analysis: PBR about 1.1x (as of 11/10 close), undervalued vs peer average (2–4x). PER is in the 200x range due to weak EPS, limiting earnings-value appeal until profits recover. Institutional and foreign inflows and surging trading volume provide positive momentum, but earnings confirmation is needed.
watchlist.sector_outlook: The second battery materials sector is expected to gradually recover after 2024–25 margin pressures, but is sensitive to EV demand, commodity prices, and policy variables. Volatility management is key until a rebound in the sector is confirmed.
watchlist.rationale: A breakout above 32,000 accompanied by trading volume and net buying by institutions/foreigners suggests a short-term trend reversal. However, the rapid rise carries overheating/retracement risk, so consider buying on a test of 30,500 with a -6.9% stop, target +18% aiming for a risk-reward of 2.6:1. Wait for earnings and flow trends to confirm.

scenario.portfolio_analysis: Currently only 1/10 slot used, leaving very high portfolio capacity. With only one automotive name, sector diversification is needed; however, entry into the overbought KOSPI (RSI 76) calls for cautious approach. Market risk is Medium-High; holding up to 7–8 names is recommended.
scenario.valuation_analysis: Shin Daeyang Paper PER 14.12x is 2–3x the industry average (4–6x), indicating a severely high valuation. Competitors (Daeyang Paper 3.88x, Sambo Paper 2.66x) have noticeably lower multiples, yet 2025 H1 operating profit fell -23% and net income -52.6%, worsening results. PBR 0.63x is fair, but a PER premium not based on profitability is prone to adjustment pressure. Relative to peers, valuation attractiveness is markedly low.
scenario.sector_outlook: Corrugated/Packaging: stable due to e-commerce demand but growth is slowing. Domestic major producers increasing output keeps supply overhang, and volatile raw-material prices and pricing power limits margin expansion. Printing/newspaper segments face structural decline. The industry is shifting toward cost-management; short-term earnings momentum is unlikely. Long-term stability but lacks growth drivers.
scenario.rationale: 1) PER 14.12x is 2–3x above the industry average, with continued weak earnings (-23%, -52.6%), increasing valuation-adjustment pressure. 2) After a short-term surge (+20%), near the 13,500 resistance with limited upside, high high-price risk; 3) Sector outlook is limited (oversupply, cost burden) with no earnings-recovery momentum. Compared with undervalued peers (Daeyang Paper, Sambo Paper), investment attractiveness is low.
scenario.market_condition: KOSPI record high (4,221.87) renewed; RSI at 76 in overbought territory. Short-term strong upside momentum but increasing risk of a pullback. Foreign and institutional net buying persists, while individuals begin to realize profits on a large scale. Short-term volatility expanding.

key_levels.volume_baseline: Usually 20,000–40,000 shares; in volatile periods, over 100,000 shares

sell_triggers: N/A - not entering
hold_conditions: N/A - not entering
trading_scenarios.portfolio_context: Currently using 1/10 slot, so portfolio headroom is ample; however entry into Shin Daeyang Paper is not advisable for the following reasons: 1) PER of 14.12x is 2–3x higher than the industry average (4–6x), 2) earnings deterioration persists (-23%, -52.6%), 3) after a short-term surge, price sits just before resistance with +20% rise, 4) industry outlook is limited. There are undervalued alternatives within the same sector (Daeyang Paper PER 3.88x, SamBo Paper PER 2.66x). Entering a stock in an overbought market without valuation merit would entail excessive risk.

watchlist.portfolio_analysis: Currently only 1/10 slot used, so portfolio headroom is very high. We hold only one auto stock, so sector diversification is needed; however, with entry into the KOSPI overbought zone (RSI 76), a cautious approach is required. Market risk is Medium-High, with a recommended max of 7–8 stocks.
watchlist.valuation_analysis: Shin Daeyang Paper PER 14.12x is 2–3x the industry average (4–6x), indicating severe overvaluation. By comparison, peers (Daeyang Paper 3.88x, SamBo Paper 2.66x) have notably lower multiples, yet earnings deteriorated in H1 2025 (operating profit down 23%, net income down 52.6%). PBR 0.63x is fair, but a profitability-less PER premium is prone to adjustment. Valuation attractiveness relative to peers in the same industry is markedly low.
watchlist.sector_outlook: The corrugated/packaging sector is steady on e-commerce demand but growth is slowing. Domestic large players’ higher output sustains oversupply pressure; volatility in raw materials (recycled paper, pulp) and difficulty passing through costs limit profitability improvements. Printing/newspaper paper is structurally shrinking. Industry-wide shift toward cost-management-driven leadership; short-term earnings momentum is hard to expect. Long-term stability but lacking growth drivers.
watchlist.market_condition: KOSPI reached a record high (4,221.87) with RSI 76 in overbought territory. Strong short-term upside momentum but increasing pullback risk. Foreign and institutional net buying continues, but individuals are beginning to take profits on a large scale. Short-term volatility expanding.
watchlist.rationale: 1) PER 14.12x is 2–3x above the industry average; ongoing earnings deterioration (-23%, -52.6%) adds pressure for valuation adjustment. 2) After a short rally (+20%), there is limited upside beyond the 13,500 won resistance; high risk in chasing highs. 3) Industry outlook is limited (oversupply, cost pressures) with no clear earnings-recovery momentum. Compared with undervalued peers (Daeyang Paper, SamBo Paper), investment appeal is low.

scenario.portfolio_analysis: Currently holding 1 stock (auto/finished-vehicle mid-term investment) with ample portfolio headroom (9 slots available). From a diversification standpoint, entering Pharmaceuticals/Holding sector is positive, but Idong Holdings exhibits extreme volatility (trading value ranking 242 -> 539 -> 242) and unstable foreign inflows, requiring cautious approach. With the market in an overbought zone (KOSPI RSI 76, KOSDAQ RSI 71), aggressive entry is not as rational as awaiting a correction.
scenario.valuation_analysis: Idong Holdings is exceptionally undervalued at PER 1.5x and PBR 0.71x versus the peer pharmaceutical holding average (PER 7–73x, PBR 0.8–2.5x). In 2024, it returned to profitability (net income KRW 63.0 billion), improved operating cash flow (KRW 17.3 billion), and better debt ratio (236.5%). However quarterly earnings are highly volatile (2025 Q2 net loss KRW 8.95 billion), with high leverage and no dividend, suggesting structural risk. The low valuation is considered to reflect earnings instability.
scenario.sector_outlook: The Pharmaceuticals/Biotech sector is underpinned by structural growth in 2025 second half due to biotech drugs, CDMO, AI drug development, and government policy support. Progress in Idong Pharmaceutical Group’s pipeline (obesity treatment, biosimilars) could lift investor sentiment. But global FX headwinds, rising R&D costs, and clinical-trial risks add volatility. Sector outlook is positive, but individual stock risks are high.
scenario.rationale: Rationale for wait-and-see decision: ① The current price (9,050 won) is in a short-term overheated zone right after a recent surge (11/3 +6.85%, VI triggered). Foreigners sold net 17,392 shares over three days, then sharply reversed with buy of +3,833 shares on 11/3, signaling unstable supply/demand. ② As of after-hours close on 11/4 at 00:29, daily volume of 476,000 shares is about 10x typical (~50,000 shares), confirming short-term overheating. ③ Entering around 9,000 won has valuation appeal, but the current upper bound is around 8,800–9,200 won relative to a recommended entry level. ④ In an overall overheated market (KOSPI RSI 76), entering a high-volatility stock presents unfavorable risk/reward. ⑤ Holding one stock provides ample cushion, but waiting for an 8,000–8,500 won correction before entry is favorable for limiting downside to -5% to -7%.

key_levels.volume_baseline: Usually 10,000–50,000 shares; during surges, 200,000 shares or more

sell_triggers: Take-Profit Condition 1: Break through 11,000–11,500 won; take profits with at least 50% of position in tranches (+21% to +27%)
Take-Profit Condition 2: If a new-drug development event triggers a jump to 13,000 won, liquidate the remaining position in full (+43% return)
Stop-Loss Condition 1: Break below 8,400 won (second support breached) → exit all positions immediately (-7.2%)
Stop-Loss Condition 2: Three consecutive days of large net selling by foreigners (over 5,000 shares per day) with a surge in volume → preemptive stop
Time Constraint: If the price remains in a 9,000–9,500 won range for three months, reduce exposure and wait to re-enter
hold_conditions: Defense of 9,000–9,200 won support + volume normalization (≤100,000 shares) → hold
Positive news from subsidiary Idong Pharmaceutical on NPD clinical trials + foreigners turning net buyers (over 3,000 shares per day) → hold until target price reached
Sustained quarterly profitability + further improvement in debt ratio (below 200%) → mid-term hold
trading_scenarios.portfolio_context: As the portfolio’s second stock for sector diversification (Automotive ↔ Pharmaceuticals); undervalued, adds stability, but extreme volatility increases portfolio risk. If entering, limit to 10% of portfolio (1 slot). In an overheated market, waiting for a pullback to buy in the 8,000–8,500 won range is optimal for risk/reward.

watchlist.portfolio_analysis: Currently holding 1 stock (auto/finished-vehicle mid-term investment) with ample portfolio headroom (9 slots available). Diversifying into Pharmaceuticals/Holding sector is positive, but Idong Holdings shows extreme volatility (trading value ranking 242→539→242) and unstable foreign demand, so a cautious approach is needed. In the overheated market, passive entry rather than aggressive entry.
watchlist.valuation_analysis: Idong Holdings is extremely undervalued with PER 1.5x and PBR 0.71x versus the peer pharmaceutical holding average (PER 7–73x, PBR 0.8–2.5x). 2024 earnings turned positive (net income KRW 63 billion), cash flow improved (KRW 17.3 billion), debt ratio improved (236.5%). Yet quarterly results are highly volatile (2025/06 quarter net loss KRW 8.95 billion), high leverage, and no dividend present—structural risks persist. The undervaluation reflects earnings instability.
watchlist.sector_outlook: The Pharmaceuticals/Biotech sector is poised for structural growth in 2025 second half via biotech drugs, CDMO growth, AI drug development, and government support. Idong Pharmaceutical Group’s new-drug pipeline progress may lift sentiment. However, global FX headwinds, rising R&D costs, and clinical-trial risk add volatility. Sector outlook is positive, but individual-stock risk is high.
watchlist.rationale: Rationale for wait-and-see: ① Current price (9,050 won) is in a short-term overheated zone after a recent spike (11/3 +6.85%, VI triggered). ② 3-day foreign net selling (-17,392 shares) followed by a sharp reversal buy (+3,833 shares) on 11/3 signals unstable flow. ③ After-hours close on 11/4, volume ≈476,000 shares, about 10x typical, confirming short-term overheating. ④ Entering near 9,000 won has valuation appeal, but current upper bound is around 8,800–9,200 won relative to suggested buy level. ⑤ In an overheated market (KOSPI RSI 76), entering a high-volatility stock offers poor risk/reward. ⑥ Holding one stock provides ample cushion, but waiting for an 8,000–8,500 won correction before entry favors risk management.

scenario.portfolio_analysis: Currently using only 1/10 slot (Hyundai Motor 1 position, automotive/finished-vehicle sector), portfolio headroom is ample. Sector concentration is low, so there is no constraint entering the semiconductor sector. The market is rallying to a record high on the KOSPI (4,221) with RSI 76 in overbought territory.
scenario.valuation_analysis: SK hynix's PER 7.5x is markedly undervalued vs. the semiconductor sector average (15x) and Samsung Electronics (13.6x). PBR 2.4x is high, but ROE above 30% justifies the profitability. Forward PER 7.77x suggests valuation appeal through 2026. Its dominance in the HBM market and a supply contract with Nvidia underpin growth.
scenario.sector_outlook: AI and data-center supercycle are driving explosive HBM demand. DRAM/NAND prices have remained strong through 2024–2025, and with HBM4 production starting by 2026, structural growth momentum is clear. However, the global semiconductor sector shows near-term overheating signals, which could lead to higher volatility.
scenario.rationale: ① Fundamentals: undervalued vs. the sector (PER 7.5x vs 15x), operating margin 40%+, exclusive HBM supply, etc. overall appeal about 9/10 ② Momentum: Nvidia supply expansion, record-high earnings leading to a new-record high break at 11.03 to 624,000 won ③ Risk: After-hours analysis at 00:27 confirms that day’s data, but 620,000 won is in the overheated zone; RSI and trading volume surge signal near-term correction risk. On 11.03 foreigners net-sold 330,000 shares, indicating potential profit-taking. ④ Stop-loss level issue: 1st support at 600,000 won (-3.2%), 2nd support at 577,000 won (-6.9%), a safe stop-loss line within -7% can be secured, but entering right after the high carries high top-fishing risk. ⑤ Risk/Reward: Target 680,000 won (+9.7%) vs stop -6.9% at 577,000 won; 1.4:1 ratio is insufficient (minimum 2:1 required). ⑥ Market condition: KOSPI RSI at 76 overheated; risk level Medium; cash 20% recommended → up to 8 stocks maximum. ⑦ Conclusion: mid-to-long-term fundamentals are solid, but entering the overheated zone immediately after a new high is very risky in an all-in/all-out system. Re-entry is reasonable if it pulls back below 600,000 won. For now, hold and wait in the 555,000–580,000 won zone.

key_levels.volume_baseline: Usually 3.5 million shares; in overheated conditions 5.5 million shares or more

sell_triggers: Take-profit Condition 1: Reach 680,000 won or fail to break through resistance at 660,000 won + sharp decline in volume -> sell all
Take-profit Condition 2: Foreign/Institutional net selling of 1,000,000 shares or more for three consecutive days + a long bearish candlestick on the daily chart appears -> sell immediately
Stop-loss Condition 1: If the 600,000 won support breaks and there is no intraday rebound, exit all at the open of the next trading day (-3.2%)
Stop-loss Condition 2: If the 577,000 won second support breaches or the daily drop is 5% or more with sharply higher volume, exit immediately (-6.9%)
Time condition: Within two weeks after entry, if the price hovers below 600,000 won, consider breakeven selling
hold_conditions: Hold Condition 1: Maintain a 600,000–624,000 won box zone and daily average volume of at least 4,000,000 shares
Hold Condition 2: Institutional/foreign net buying turns positive (daily net buy 300,000 shares or more) + announcement of additional HBM4 orders
Hold Condition 3: Confirm operating margin of 40%+; support at around KOSPI 4,100; continued strength in the semiconductor sector
trading_scenarios.portfolio_context: Currently using 1/10 slot for new entry into the semiconductor sector, contributing to portfolio diversification. However, entering in the overheated zone after a new high would sharply increase overall portfolio volatility. Market overheating allows a maximum of 8 stocks; there is still room for 3 more, but at the current price (620,000 won) entry is not appropriate. If it pulls back to 577,000–600,000, re-evaluation is needed. As a beneficiary of the mid- to long-term AI supercycle, there is room to raise the target, but with a 100% all-in system a -15% loss would require +17.6% gain to break even, so chasing the new high is not advised.

watchlist.portfolio_analysis: Currently using only 1 of 10 slots (Hyundai Motor Group stock, automotive/vehicles sector), leaving ample portfolio capacity. Industry exposure is low, so there are no constraints on entering the semiconductor sector. The market is rallying toward the KOSPI all-time high (4,221), but RSI at 76 indicates an overheated regime.

PBR of 2.4x is high, but ROE of 30%+ and strong profitability justify it. Forward PER of 7.77x suggests valuation appeal persists through 2026. Its exclusive HBM market position and an NVIDIA supply contract support growth.

DRAM/NAND prices remain strong through 2024–2025, and with HBM4 mass production by 2026, structural growth momentum is clear. However, the global semiconductor sector shows signs of short-term overheating, which could raise volatility.
watchlist.rationale: ① Fundamentals: undervalued vs. the sector (PER 7.5x vs 15x), operating margin 40%+, exclusive HBM supply, etc. overall appeal about 9/10 ② Momentum: Nvidia supply expansion, record-high earnings leading to a new-record high break at 11.03 to 624,000 won ③ Risk: After-hours analysis at 00:27 confirms that day’s data, but 620,000 won is in the overheated zone; RSI and trading volume surge signal near-term correction risk. On 11.03 foreigners net-sold 330,000 shares, indicating potential profit-taking. ④ Stop-loss level issue: 1st support at 600,000 won (-3.2%), 2nd support at 577,000 won (-6.9%), a safe stop-loss line within -7% can be secured, but entering right after the high carries high top-fishing risk. ⑤ Risk/Reward: Target 680,000 won (+9.7%) vs stop -6.9% at 577,000 won; 1.4:1 ratio is insufficient (minimum 2:1 required). ⑥ Market condition: KOSPI RSI at 76 overheated; risk level Medium; cash 20% recommended → up to 8 stocks maximum. ⑦ Conclusion: mid-to-long-term fundamentals are solid, but entering the overheated zone immediately after a new high is very risky in an all-in/all-out system. Re-entry is reasonable if it pulls back below 600,000 won. For now, hold and wait in the 555,000–580,000 won zone.

scenario.portfolio_analysis: Hold 0/10 slots, cash 100%. No sector exposure; no holdings in short/medium/long term. For a first entry, target only setups with risk-reward of at least 2:1.
scenario.valuation_analysis: Hyundai AutoEver PER 20–24x, PBR 2.0–2.7x, EV/EBITDA 8.0–9.5x, premium versus IT services sector average (PER 13–16, PBR 1.3–1.8, EV/EBITDA 7–8). Growth story (vehicle software/platform) justifies it, but valuation concerns exist. (Source: FnGuide / major securities firms’ reports)
scenario.sector_outlook: IT Services / Digital Transformation demand remains solid; positive for smart factory and mobility software expansion. However, valuation could adjust if market volatility widens.
scenario.rationale: Momentum confirmed by surge in turnover, but premium vs. the sector. If 150,000 support is confirmed, stop-loss -6.7%, target +13.3% to secure 2:1. Recognize resistance at the upper end of the box (170k–175k).

sell_triggers: Take-profit Condition 1: Sell all when 170,000 is reached (box upper resistance)
Take-profit Condition 2: After entering the 170,000–175,000 zone, a long bearish candlestick appears with decreasing volume -> sell all
Stop-loss Condition 1: After confirming 150,000 support and entry, if 140,000 closes below, exit all immediately (loss within -6.7%)
Stop-loss Condition 2: If the support breaks and the next day gaps down with sharply higher volume (accelerated decline), exit immediately without delay
Time condition: If price trades in a 150,000–165,000 box for 4 weeks or more with volume contraction, consider opportunity cost and exit
hold_conditions: Break above 155,000 and hold for three consecutive trading days to confirm trend reversal
Hold if institutional/foreign net buying persists and trading above the 20-day line
Maintain momentum from earnings / orders / events (large SI orders, platform collaborations) before and after announcements
trading_scenarios.portfolio_context: First slot (10%) test entry. No excessive sector exposure risk. Adhere to the -7% stop; if the support breaks, exit immediately

watchlist.portfolio_analysis: Hold 0/10 slots, cash 100%. No sector exposure; no holdings in short/medium/long term. For first entry, target only setups with risk-reward of at least 2:1
watchlist.valuation_analysis: Hyundai AutoEver PER 20–24x, PBR 2.0–2.7x, EV/EBITDA 8.0–9.5x, premium versus IT services sector average (PER 13–16, PBR 1.3–1.8, EV/EBITDA 7–8). Growth story (vehicle software/platform) justifies it, but valuation concerns exist. (Source: FnGuide / major securities firms’ reports)
watchlist.sector_outlook: IT services/digital transformation demand remains solid, with a positive outlook for expansion of smart factory and mobility software. However, valuations could adjust if market volatility widens.
watchlist.rationale: Momentum is confirmed by a surge in trading volume, but the stock trades at a premium to the sector. If 150,000 holds as support, set a stop-loss at -6.7% and target a +13.3% gain for a 2:1 reward-to-risk. Resistance is expected at the upper end of the box range (170k–175k).

scenario.portfolio_analysis: Current holdings 0/10 slots, no sector tilt. An initial slot (10%) can be used to explore, but since partial purchases are not allowed, entry and stop-loss criteria must be strictly applied. Recent surge in trading volume (rank from 410→83) confirms short-term momentum inflow.
scenario.valuation_analysis: External comparison benchmarks (last four quarters / estimates): Uniquest PER 23–27x, P/B 0.63–0.70x, ROE about 2.6% vs. industry average (PER 8–12x, P/B 0.9–1.1x, ROE 9–11%). PER is high and ROE is low, so there is limited basis for a re-rating. P/B undervaluation reflects a structural discount due to low ROE. The report mentions PER 12–13x, creating a discrepancy; re-check latest results/consensus is recommended.
scenario.sector_outlook: The semiconductor distribution / IT components solutions sector shows mixed volatility due to stabilizing supply chains and solid vehicle-semiconductor demand, against a backdrop of a global semiconductor downturn and interest-rate variables. News momentum (new orders/partnerships) can provide upside, but macro risks imply greater elasticity on downside.
scenario.rationale: Support near the box bottom (11,000–11,500) and surge in trading volume indicate short-term momentum. However, high PER and low ROE limit value appeal. If the support line is clear, swing entry is possible with limited risk.

key_levels.volume_baseline: 150–200% or more of the 20-day average volume

sell_triggers: Take-profit Condition 1: Near 12,500, if volume slows and a long bearish candle or upper wick appears, sell all
Take-profit Condition 2: If a breakout above 13,000 fails and closes back below 12,500 (with decreasing volume), sell all
Stop-loss Condition 1: If the close falls below 10,800, exit all immediately
Stop-loss Condition 2: If it breaks 11,000 and fails to rebound with rising volume, accelerating the decline even intraday, cut losses
Time condition: If there is no attempt to break 12,500 within 10–15 trading days and volume dries up, consider liquidating to account for opportunity cost
hold_conditions: 20-day and 60-day moving averages are both on an uptrend, and close above 11,200
Institutions/foreign net-buying trend persists or liquidity ranking remains among the top in trading value
Break above 13,000: confirm the box-top resistance has turned into support (close above 12,700); if confirmed, maintain trend-following
trading_scenarios.portfolio_context: Access with only one initial slot. No scale-in; enter on a test of 11,200± or re-enter only after a confirmed breakout of 12,500 and pullback. Stop-loss width targeted at about -3.6% to -5% (based on 10,800) to secure an R/R of at least 2:1. In a market-neutral (sideways) phase, holdings can be expanded up to eight, but avoid duplicate sector holdings due to limited valuation appeal.

watchlist.portfolio_analysis: Current holdings 0/10 slots, no sector tilt. An initial slot (10%) can be used to explore, but since partial purchases are not allowed, entry and stop-loss criteria must be strictly applied. Recent surge in trading volume (rank from 410→83) confirms short-term momentum inflow.
watchlist.valuation_analysis: External comparison benchmarks (last four quarters / estimates): Uniquest PER 23–27x, P/B 0.63–0.70x, ROE about 2.6% vs. industry average (PER 8–12x, P/B 0.9–1.1x, ROE 9–11%). PER is high and ROE is low, so there is limited basis for a re-rating. P/B undervaluation reflects a structural discount due to low ROE. The report mentions PER 12–13x, creating a discrepancy; re-check latest results/consensus is recommended.
watchlist.sector_outlook: The semiconductor distribution / IT components solutions sector shows mixed volatility due to stabilizing supply chains and solid vehicle-semiconductor demand, against a backdrop of a global semiconductor downturn and rate risks. News momentum (new orders/partnerships) can provide upside, but macro risks imply greater elasticity on downside.
watchlist.rationale: Support near the box bottom (11,000–11,500) and surge in trading volume indicate short-term momentum. However, high PER and low ROE limit value appeal. If the support line is clear, swing entry is possible with limited risk.

holding_decisions.sell_reason: In a bullish market, after clearing the 185,000 top and with rising volume, approaching 200,000 (high 198,100). Foreigners (+744,617) / institutions (+231,822) net buying, close at 195,100 with breakout valid. The take-profit conditions in the user scenario (reach 200,000 or slow/turn at 205,000–210,000) are not met; take-profit Condition 2 (not reaching 200,000 within 3 trading days + rapid drop in volume) not yet applicable. Stop-loss (break below 175,000) also not met. In a bull market, trend-first and avoid premature take-profits; continue holding.
holding_decisions.volume_analysis: 최근 2거래일 거래량 급증(평균 대비 대폭 상회: 11/13 338만주, 11/12 243만주), 돌파 동반 거래량으로 신뢰도 높음. 외국인/기관 동반 순매수 지속.
holding_decisions.market_condition_impact: 지수(KOSPI/KOSDAQ) 모두 10월 중순 저점 이후 우상향, 20일선 위 상승 흐름으로 판단. 4개 체크 중 3개 이상 충족(지수 20일선 상방, 종목 수급 양호, 종목 거래량 평균 상회) → 강세장 판정에 따라 추세 우선 보유.
holding_decisions.time_factor: 보유 0일의 단기 포지션으로 돌파 초기 구간. 시나리오상 3~10거래일 관찰 기간 내 상단(200000~210000) 테스트 기대 구간.
holding_decisions.adjustment_reason: The current strategy (R/R > 2: target 210,000, stop at 175,000) remains valid, and clear trend-strengthening signals are evident. Avoid unnecessary frequent adjustments.

full_json_data.sell_reason: In a bullish environment, after breaking 185,000 with a surge in volume and approaching near 200,000 (high 198,100). Foreigners (+744,617)/institutions (+231,822) net purchases; breakout confirmed with close at 195,100. The take-profit conditions in the user scenario (reach 200,000 or slow/turn at 205,000–210,000) are not met; take-profit Condition 2 (not reaching 200,000 within 3 trading days + rapid drop in volume) not yet met. Stop-loss (break below 175,000) also not met. In a bull market, trend-first and avoid premature take-profits; continue holding.

portfolio_adjustment.reason: 기존 전략(R/R>2: 목표 210000, 손절 175000)이 여전히 유효하고 추세 강화 신호가 뚜렷함. 불필요한 잦은 조정 지양.

holding_decisions.sell_reason: No full-sell signal. Stop-loss at 238,000 not breached; two of the last three trading days show gains, indicating a short-term rebound. Foreign/institutional net buying turned positive (11/12–11/13). KOSPI and KOSDAQ are above the 20-day line with a bullish market condition (upward index trend, favorable liquidity). The target price of 280,000 is a minimum in a bull market, so avoid premature selling before trend weakness is confirmed.
